Journal.Title: International journal of systematic and evolutionary microbiology

Article.ArticleTitle: Absidia panacisoli sp. nov., isolated from rhizosphere of Panax notoginseng.

AbstractText: A strain (SYPF 7183<sup>T</sup>) was isolated from rhizosphere soil of Panax notoginseng in southwest China. Phylogenetic analyses indicated that strain SYPF 7183<sup>T</sup> was distinct from the other Absidia species with well-supported values. Strain SYPF 7183<sup>T</sup> produced spherical or subpyriform sporangia and short cylindrical sporangiospores. The azygospores were globose to oval. Based on morphological and phylogenetic evidence, the novel strain Absidia panacisoli sp. nov. is proposed.
